text:
A Waiting Game

Raskolnikov waits nervously in a dimly lit office.  
He feels eyes on him, but sees only clerks.  

Raskolnikov: “Why am I still here?”  

Clerk 1: “Just another day at the office.”  

Clerk 2: “He’ll be called soon.”  

---  

Raskolnikov glances around, anxiety building.  
Thoughts race through his mind.  

Raskolnikov: “What if they know?”  

Raskolnikov: “What if he saw everything?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov anxiously waits at the investigation department, feeling paranoid about being observed while questioning whether anyone knows of his involvement in a crime.
